title: Ana de Armas gives James Bond a run for his money for Knives Out
text:
Frankly, Ana could be the next Bond in that suit

Daniel Craig may have missed the premiere of his latest film Knives Out on Tuesday night, but co-star Ana de Armas well and truly repped the tuxedo game.

The two stars both work together in the James Bond franchise as well as the Rian Johnson-directed flick, as cast and crew walked the red carpet at BFI London Film Festival last night.

A last-minute addition to the red carpet, Ana walked alongside director Rian and co-stars Katherine Langford and Don Johnson as the rain held off just long enough for them to stop for some snaps.

13 Reasons Why star Katherine donned a canary yellow dress for the event, however following behind Ana wasn’t about to get a cold as she sported a sleek tuxedo in the chilly temps.

Complete with a ruffled blouse and smart bow-tie, the Cuban-Spanish actress – who plays Paloma in the upcoming Bond No Time To Die – smouldered for the camera as she was rushed down the red carpet to make the film’s screening on time.

Loving everything about her outfit (Picture: Doug Peters/EMPICS)

YASS (Picture: Rex Features)

Described as a ‘modern take on a classic whodunit’, Knives Out is a sizzling and suspenseful film written and directed by Rian, who also directed Star Wars: The Last Jedi.

The neo-noir black comedy mystery follows Detective Benoit Blanc (Daniel) who is enlisted to investigate after crime novelist and patriarch Harlan Thrombey (Christopher Plummer) is found dead at his estate just after his 85th birthday party.

Katherine wore a canary yellow gown (Picture: Scott Garfitt / BACKGRID)

Don was suited and booted (Picture: Rex Features)

Far-from a standard Poirot, a hilarious star-studded cast of Ana, Chris Evans, Jamie Lee Curtis, Toni Colette and Katherine form the victim’s eccentric family who have more than a few skeletons in their closet.

The film has been a long time coming for Rian who initially floated the idea after making Looper in 2012, but was otherwise occupied with directing something in a galaxy far, far away.

Before its European premiere at LFF (after first being screened at Toronto Film Festival recently) Festival director Tricia Tuttle said: ‘With Knives Out, Rian Johnson has crafted a devilishly clever and wickedly entertaining new crime caper.’

Ana will next star in No Time To Die (out 2 April 2020) alongside Daniel and Naomie Harris, who recently teased the evolution of the infamous character of 007.

Ana with Bond cast members Lea Seydoux, Daniel Craig, Naomie Harris and Lashana Lynch (Picture: Getty Images)

Noamie, who plays Miss Moneypenny in the beloved franchise, said: ‘It’s a tie-up of Skyfall and Spectre. But with massive, massive surprises that even had me like, “Oh, wow!” So I think we’re going to really shock people.’

She continued to GQ Hype we may see a freshly emotional Bond, who is perhaps shirking the overly masculine caricature of the past.

‘I would say that he’s reconnected with his heart. We’re deﬁnitely seeing a Bond who’s more in touch with his feelings and more open to falling in love,’ she continued.

‘At the end of Spectre there are women he gives his career up for: there’s no more emotional attachment than that. It’s just about moving with the times and recognising that women can no longer be seen as eye candy.’

Knives Out is in UK cinemas 29 November.
